question: Why does Nanny claim that the black woman is the 'mule uh the world'?
answer: Nanny explains that the black woman is 'de mule uh de world' because she bears the burden that is passed down through a hierarchy of oppression. According to Nanny, the white man is 'de ruler of everything' and when he has a load to carry, he throws it down and tells the black man to pick it up. The black man picks it up because he has to, but he doesn't carry it himself - instead, he hands it to his womenfolks. Thus, the black woman ends up at the bottom of this chain, carrying the burdens that have been passed down from white men to black men and finally to her. Like a mule, she is forced to bear the heaviest loads while having the least power. Nanny shares this painful observation with Janie because she has been praying for Janie's life to be different from this pattern of exploitation.
quote: Honey, de white man is de ruler of everything as fur as Ah been able tuh find out. Maybe it's some place way off in de ocean where de black man is in power, but we don't know nothin' but what we see. So de white man throw down de load and tell de nigger man tuh pick it up. He pick it up because he have to, but he don't tote it. He hand it to his womenfolks. De nigger woman is de mule uh de world so fur as Ah can see. Ah been prayin' fuh it tuh be different wid you.
